Jugl. Attribute

Instances of this class contain a DOM element and methods to process Jugl statements.  Create a new instance with the {Jugl.Attribute} constructor.

Summary
Jugl. Attribute
Instances of this class contain a DOM element and methods to process Jugl statements.
Properties
element
{Jugl.Element} The owner element of this attribute.
node
{AttributeElement} The DOM attribute node that this represents.
type
{String} The attribute type, one of the supported Jugl statement types.
nodeValue
{String} The value of this node, a Jugl expression.
template
{Jugl.Template} The template that this attribute belongs to.
Functions
Jugl. Attribute

Split space-delimited attribute values.
splitExpressionPrefix
Split the optional type prefix off of a content or replace expression.
getAttributeValues
Split semicolon-delimited attributes into an array of expressions
removeSelf
Remove this attribute from its node.
process
Process this attribute.
evalInScope
Evaluate a Jugl expression given the scope of its node.
Properties
processAttribute
{Object} Contains methods to process attributes based on type.
Functions
processAttribute. define
Add a variable to the element’s scope.
processAttribute. condition
Test the expression given in the attribute.
processAttribute. repeat
Replicate a subtree of your document.
processAttribute. content
Rather than replacing an entire element, you can insert text or structure in place of its children with the content statement.
processAttribute. replace
Replace the entire element with the result of the expression.
processAttribute. attributes
Add attributes to this element.
processAttribute. omit-tag
Remove the tag and leave contents in place.
processAttribute. reflow
Trigger browser reflow after processing other attributes.

CLASS_NAME
{String} Name of this class

Properties

element

{Jugl.Element} The owner element of this attribute.

node

{AttributeElement} The DOM attribute node that this represents.

type

{String} The attribute type, one of the supported Jugl statement types.

nodeValue

{String} The value of this node, a Jugl expression.

template

{Jugl.Template} The template that this attribute belongs to.

Functions

Jugl. Attribute

Parameters

element{Jugl.Element}
node{AttributeNode}
type{String} The localName of the attribute

Return

{Jugl.Attribute} A new Jugl attribute

splitAttributeValue

splitAttributeValue: function(value)

Split space-delimited attribute values.

Parameters

value{String} Optional value to pass in.  If not included the nodeValue of the attribute node will be used.

Return

{Array} A two item arrayitems have excess spaces trimmed.

splitExpressionPrefix

splitExpressionPrefix: function()

Split the optional type prefix off of a content or replace expression.

Return

{Array} A two item array [prefix, expression].

getAttributeValues

getAttributeValues: function()

Split semicolon-delimited attributes into an array of expressions

Return

{Array} An array of Jugl expressions.

removeSelf

removeSelf: function()

Remove this attribute from its node.

process

process: function()

Process this attribute.  This method is called by the template to process the attribute based on its type.  Attribute processing results in DOM manipulations.  This method calls the appropriate method in Jugl.Attribute.processAttribute.

Return

{Boolean} The attribute was successfully processed.

evalInScope

evalInScope: function(str)

Evaluate a Jugl expression given the scope of its node.

Return

{Object} The result of the expression evaluated.

Properties

processAttribute

{Object} Contains methods to process attributes based on type.  These methods are called by Jugl.Attribute.process

Functions

processAttribute. define

Add a variable to the element’s scope.  This variable can be used in other attributes on this element, or by child nodes.  Access the value of the variable in an attribute the variable name.  Child nodes defining variables with the same name as parent nodes overwrite those variables for their own scope (and the scope of any child nodes).

Return

{Boolean} A variable was defined

processAttribute. condition

Test the expression given in the attribute.  Continue processing this element if the attribute’s value expression evaluates to true.

Return

{Boolean} Continue processing this element.

processAttribute. repeat

Replicate a subtree of your document.  The expression is evaluated once for each item in an array or property in an object.  The expression should evaluate to an array or object.  If the sequence is empty, then the statement element is deleted, otherwise it is repeated for each value in the sequence.

Return

{Boolean} Continue processing this element.

processAttribute. content

Rather than replacing an entire element, you can insert text or structure in place of its children with the content statement.

Return

{Boolean} The attribute value was successfully evaluated.

processAttribute. replace

Replace the entire element with the result of the expression.

Return

{Boolean} The attribute value was successfully evaluated.

processAttribute. attributes

Add attributes to this element.

Return

{Boolean} The attribute value was successfully evaluated.

processAttribute. omit-tag

Remove the tag and leave contents in place.  Leave the contents of a tag in place while omitting the surrounding start and end tag.  If its expression evaluates to a false value, then normal processing of the element continues.  If the expression evaluates to a true value, or there is no expression, the statement tag is replaced with its contents.

Return

{Boolean} Continue processing this element.

processAttribute. reflow

Trigger browser reflow after processing other attributes.  Given an empty string or any expression that evaluates to true, a reflow will be triggered.  Given an expression that evaluates to false (other than an empty string), no action will be taken.

Return

{Boolean} Continue processing this element.

Constants

CLASS_NAME

{String} Name of this class
Generated by Natural Docs
Instances of this class contain a DOM element and methods to process Jugl statements.
Instances of this class are used to process Jugl templates.
